title: Blood Money: The Swiss, the Nazis and the Looted Billions
description: This work reveals the role played by the Swiss banks and the Swiss government in exploiting World War II and the Holocaust to their financial advantage; a role which included helping the Nazis to hide and sell their loot siezed from occupied Europe, and stealing the deposits made in those banks by Jewish individuals and organizations. The book is supported by leading campaigners such as Senator d'Amato, Chairman of the US Banking Centre and the Simon Wiesenthal Centre.
author: Tom Bower
